dailyPriceChange.name: Micron Technology, Inc.
dailyPriceChange.news: Micron Technology's stock surged 6.61% to close at $389.11 amid a severe memory chip shortage driven by exploding AI demand across sectors. CEO Sanjay Mehrotra emphasized memory as a "key enabler of AI" and a strategic asset, noting long lead times for new fabrication plants despite expansions like acquiring a Taiwanese site and $200 billion U.S. investments. The shortage has boosted prices and fully booked Micron's AI memory products through 2026, supporting strong momentum with the stock up 255.74% over the past year.

dailyPriceChange.name: Sandisk Corporation
dailyPriceChange.news: **Sandisk Corporation (SNDK) stock surged 10.63% to $501.29, driven by its position as a leading beneficiary of the AI-driven NAND flash memory supercycle, with strong demand from data centers and complex AI workloads amid supply shortages.** **The article highlights Sandisk's technological advancements, including the BiCS8 node for scalability in edge and cloud AI applications and upcoming high-bandwidth flash (HBF) innovations, positioning it for outsized growth as data centers become the primary NAND demand driver.** **This momentum follows an 800%+ rise since its February 2025 spinoff from Western Digital, fueled by favorable pricing tailwinds and accelerating bit demand.**
